page.title: 20Sandwich:Local News 1985
page.content: Three events are recorded here. 1)The Toll Bridge in Sandwich was the site of a fatal accident in May.A Jaguar car driven by an invalid driver crashed through the Toll Bridge railing and careered into the fast running tidal river.Although repeated attempts were made by divers he was not rescued alive. 2)Mr.R.R.Chesterfield has been elected Mayor of Sandwich for a third term of office.At Sandwich Junior School he acted first in his role as Deputy Head and organised the local "Sports Day" and then in his role as Mayor by presenting cups and certificates. 3)Three local schools helped to compile the information needed for the Domesday Project.They were;Sir Roger Manwood's Grammar School,Sandwich Junior School and Worth County Primary School.
